channel.title: CVE Feed for Secheron -- SEPCOS Control and Protection Relay firmware package
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Secheron -- SEPCOS Control and Protection Relay firmware package

item.title: CVE-2022-1667|2024-08-03T00:10:03.859Z -- secheron -- sepcos%20control%20and%20protection%20relay%20firmware%20package
item.description: Client-side JavaScript controls may be bypassed by directly running a JS function to reboot the PLC (e.g., from the browser console) or by loading the corresponding, browser accessible PHP script

item.title: CVE-2022-1666|2024-08-03T00:10:03.910Z -- secheron -- sepcos%20control%20and%20protection%20relay%20firmware%20package
item.description: The default password for the web application’s root user (the vendor’s private account) was weak and the MD5 hash was used to crack the password using a widely available open-source tool.

item.title: CVE-2022-1668|2024-08-03T00:10:03.818Z -- secheron -- sepcos%20control%20and%20protection%20relay%20firmware%20package
item.description: Weak default root user credentials allow remote attackers to easily obtain OS superuser privileges over the open TCP port for SSH.
